T:Kusto.Data.Charting.TimePivot
member.summary:
A time pivot transforms a data grid (a rectangular grid of cells, like ) into a tree of nodes organized by a subset of the column values of the data grid, with the leaf nodes pointing to all rows in the data grid that hold values matching the column values represented by the lead nodes, organized by a column.
For example, we might have a hierarchy in which Col1 is an ActivityId and Col2 is a ParentActivityId, and then ask the time pivot to produce a tree representing the parent/child relationships of the tree records by time.

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.Charting.TimePivot.#ctor(System.Data.DataTable,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The data to pivot. Mandatory and immutable.
The column name to pivot by. This argument is optional; if null, the first column of this type in the data will be used.

member.summary: Pivot the data by any number of columns.

member.summary: If specified, indicates that the request cannot invoke code in the ExternalTable.

member.summary: When evaluating the bin_auto() function, the start value to use. [String]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.QueryBinAutoSize
member.summary: When evaluating the bin_auto() function, the bin size value to use. [String]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryDataScope
member.summary:
Controls the query's datascope -- whether the query applies to all data or just part of it. ['default', 'all', or 'hotcache']
"default" means that the datascope is undefined at this level (eventually it means 'all' if not overridden by anything). "all" means that the datascope includes all data in the cluster. "hotcache" means that the datascope is all data that is categorized as "hot cache" in the caching policy.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryLanguage
member.summary:
Controls how the query text is to be interpreted. ['kql', 'csl' or 'sql']
"kql" means that the query text is in the Kusto query language "csl" means that the query text is in the Kusto query language (alias to 'kql') "sql" means that the query text is in T-SQL.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryNow
member.summary: Overrides the datetime value returned by the now(0s) function. [DateTime]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryCursorCurrent
member.summary: Overrides the cursor value returned by the cursor_current() or current_cursor() functions. [string]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryCursorAfterDefault
member.summary: The default parameter value of the cursor_after() function when called without parameters. [string]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryCursorBeforeOrAtDefault
member.summary: The default parameter value of the cursor_before_or_at() function when called without parameters. [string]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionValidatePermissions
member.summary: Validates user's permissions to perform the query and doesn't run the query itself. [Boolean][Internal]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionAllowProjectionAndExtensionUnderSearch
member.summary: The name of the Boolean option that enables running 'find' or 'search' over projected and extended tables as 'find' instead of 'union'

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionClientDumpHttpRequestResponse
member.summary:
Controls how Kusto.Data!Kusto.Data.Net.Client.RestClient2 dumps the HTTP request/response streams. ['none' or 'console' or 'trace'][Internal]
Valid values for this property can be "default" (write headers only, to traces), "trace" (write both headers and body to traces), "console" (write to headers and body to traces and System.Console both), or "none" (write nothing).

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionDebugQueryPlanningDelayMsec

member.summary: Overrides the dfefault maximum data size a query is allowed to return to the caller (truncation). [Long]

member.summary: Enables limiting query results to this number of records. [Long]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryFanoutThreadsPercent
member.summary: The name of an Integer option that controls the percentage of threads on each node to fanout query execution to. Defaults to 100% (use all available threads).

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionDebugQueryFanoutThreadsPercentExternalData
member.summary: The name of an Integer option that controls the percentage of threads on each node to fanout query execution to. Defaults to 100% (single partition per CPU core). Note that percentages larger than 100% are currently supported, as threads that read external data often incur less CPU load.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryFanoutNodesPercent
member.summary: The name of an Integer option that controls the percentage of nodes on the cluster to fanout query execution to. Defaults to 100% (use all available nodes).

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryDistributionNodesSpanSize
F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionDebugQueryDisableExternalDataProjectionFusion
member.summary: The name of the Boolean option that prevents fusing projection into ExternalData operator

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionDeferPartialQueryFailures
member.summary:
If true, disables reporting partial query failures as part of the result set. [Boolean]
Default (false or not set): report failures as soon as possible as part of the result stream. When the option is set: try to complete the result stream and report all partial failures as part of the "query status" result in the end.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionResponseDynamicSerialization
member.summary: Controls the serialization of 'dynamic' values in result sets. ['string', 'json', 'default']

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionResponseDynamicSerialization_2
member.summary: Controls the serialization of 'dynamic' string and null values in result sets. ['legacy', 'current', 'default' ]" If legacy - dynamic strings are serialized by their inferred type ("123" --> 123) and dynamic nulls are serialized as empty strings. If current - serialization of dynamic strings is "faithful to origin" (a string remains a string), dynamic nulls are serialized as nulls.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionResultsProgressiveEnabled
member.summary: If set, enables a progressive query stream. a Progressive query stream is a stream that includes more information about the query processing state (progress) and additionally, tells the client what to do with every data frame (e.g, replace the existing data with the new data frame or append the new data frame to the results so far)

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionProgressiveProgressReportPeriod
member.summary: If is set, serves as a hint to Kusto as to how often the client wishes to receive progress frames, i.e. frames that informs the client about the query progress

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionProgressiveQueryMinRowCountPerUpdate
member.summary: If is set, serves as a hint to Kusto as to how many records the client wishes to receive in each update.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionBlockSplittingEnabled
member.summary: Enables splitting of sequence blocks after aggregation operator. [Boolean]

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionPushSelectionThroughAggregation
member.summary: The name of the Boolean option that enables pushing selection through aggregation. Relevant case: T | summarize aggrfunc() by X | where X == "xxx".

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionAdminSuperSlackerMode
member.summary: Controls the option if AdminService delegates executing the query to another node. (Default behavior is Admin executing the query)

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionQueryConsistency
member.summary:
Controls query consistency. ['strongconsistency' or 'normalconsistency' or 'weakconsistency']
"strongconsistency" means that the query runs with a snapshot of the metadata that is at least as updated as when the query begun. "weakconsistency" or empty (it is the default) means that it is eventually consistent. "normalconsistency" means that the client's IP address and port are hashed so that queries over the same connection are consistent.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionNoPrejoin
member.summary: The name of the Boolean option that controls whether pre-join filter optimization is disabled.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionNoParallelQueryOptimizer
member.summary: The name of the Boolean option that controls whether parallelizations in the query optimizer are disabled.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionInjectSelectionBeforeExtensionOptimizer
member.summary: The name of the Boolean option that controls whether dynamic extension optimization (injecting selection before extension with dynamic value) in the query optimizer are enabled.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.PushRangeOperatorToShardEngine
member.summary: When true, pushes the range operator to the shard (v3) engine.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.PushExperimentalOperatorsToShardEngine
member.summary: When true, pushes various experimental/work-in-progress operators and scalar functions to the shard (v3) engine.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.EnableShardQueryDiagnostics
member.summary: Enables detailed diagnostics of the shard query (v3). When true, ShardAccessNode in the query plan will have an additional Diagnostics field with all the gory details of the prepared shard engine query. The intended use of this flag is mainly by the '.show queryplan' command.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Common.ClientRequestProperties.OptionDebugShardQueryMultiplyShards
member.summary: Multiplies the shards in the shard/extent hierarchy lists by the specified factor. Useful in micro-benchmarking.

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.Common.CslCommandGenerator.CombineCommandWithFollowupQuery(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Combines an admin command with a follow-up query. The way to combine is specified by the first non-whitespace character in . If it is a pipe (|) character, then the admin command's results are piped. If it is a semicolon (;), then the admin command's results are stored in the symbol $command_results and the query then follows.

member.summary: Creates a command to get extents metadata for all extents in the specified databases.

Creates a command to get extents metadata for all extents in the specified tables. Example: .show tables (T1, T2) extents where tags has 'tag1' and tags contains 'tag2' The names of the tables. Optional equality tags filters ('has'). Optional case-insensitive substring tags filters ('contains'). Optional equality tags negative filters ('!has'). Optional case-insensitive substring tags negative filters ('!contains'). Optional boolean indicating whether or not to include only extents which are in the hot-cache.

Creates a command to get extents metadata for all extents in the specified table. Example: .show table T extents where tags has 'tag1' and tags contains 'tag2' The name of the table. Optional equality tags filters ('has'). Optional case-insensitive substring tags filters ('contains'). Optional equality tags negative filters ('!has'). Optional case-insensitive substring tags negative filters ('!contains'). Optional boolean indicating whether or not to include only extents which are in the hot-cache.

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.Common.CslCommandGenerator.GenerateExportToSqlDatabaseCommand(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create command to export qurey result to an table in SQL database
Creates a command to export data to blob storage.
member.param: A collection of one or more blob container URIs. One container will be chosen randomly for each blob file.
The query whose results should be exported.
Whether or not to invoke the command in an async manner.
Whether or not to use GZ compression on the created blobs.
The type of compression to use. csv/json/tsv support gzip only. Parquet supports gzip and snappy.
A limitation on the file size in bytes (before compression). If not specified, the default value is 100MB. The maximum value is 1GB.
A constant prefix for the file names. If not specified, a GUID will be used. The suffix will be "_" + ordinalnumber.
The format of the output files (CSV, TSV, JSON, PARQUET).
Controls the encoding of the output file. Supported encodings: UTF8NoBOM, UTF8BOM. Default: UTF8NoBOM
Whether or not to run export in a distributed fashion (null lets the system choose).
Whether to persist the command results. This is the default on async export commands. Set to false if you're not interested

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Common.CslLiteralParseHelper
member.summary: A small helper class for parsing CSL literals that are formatted like: `name` WS `(` *string-or-value* `)` with possible whitespace around.

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.Common.CslLiteralParseHelper.MatchWhiteSpace(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Attempts to match whitespace characters in the string at position . If there's a match, returns true and advances i to the next position following the WhiteSpace run (potentially to the end of the string). Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.Common.CslLiteralParseHelper.Match(System.String,System.Char,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Attempts to match the character in the string at position . If there's a match, returns true and advances i (potentially to the end of the string). Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.Common.CslLiteralParseHelper.Match(System.String,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Attempts to match the substring in the string at position . If there's a match, returns true and advances i (potentially to the end of the string). Otherwise, returns false.

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.Common.CslLiteralParseHelper.TryMatch(System.String,System.String,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Attempts to match with the format `type` `(` ... `)`. Returns true if successful, and sets / to the start position of length of the `...` part.
member.remarks: We don't handle strings with prefix or suffix whitespace.

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Common.CslBoolLiteral
member.summary: A static class that can parse strings formatted as literals of CslType 'bool' and produce such literals.
member.remarks:
The following formats are supported:
true
false
bool(true)
bool(false)
bool(null)

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Common.CslIntLiteral
member.summary: A static class that can parse strings formatted as literals of CslType 'int' and produce such literals.
member.remarks:
The following formats are supported:
A sequence of decimal digits, optionally prefixed by a unary plus or minus sign.
A sequence of hexadecimal digits, prefixed by a "0x" or "0X".
A string beginning by either "int(" or "integer(" or "int32(" (case sensitive), ending by a ")", and in between either type of previous strings or "null".

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.ExtendedTrackableOperationKind.FallsUnderIngestCategory(Kusto.Data.AdminTrackableOperationKind)
member.summary: Should this operation be counted as an ingest operation?
member.remarks: Note that extent rebuild by query, used for purge processes, is also counted as an ingestion operation for capacity calculation purposes (both ingestion and rebuild for purge use the same capacity quota). Also note that "TableSetOrAppend" and "TableSetOrReplace" are intentionally left out, as they don't actually consume capacity on their own - they create an instance of the relevant command, Table(Set|Append|Replace), which is the one to consume capacity.

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Net.Client.KustoClientFactory
member.summary: A factory for and implementations, based on the service/database connection string.
member.remarks:
By default, Kusto supports the "http", "https", and "net.tcp" as connection schemes between the client and service.
Additionally, this class also allows for scenarios in which callers want to add their own client provider factories and attach them to arbitrary connection schemes, as long as these schemes don't override the default ones. Processes that host the engine itself can use a specific connection scheme ("embedded", this.InProcessDataSourceScheme) to communicate with the hosted engine.

Convert a dynamic value to its correct serialized representation, according to and options. Legacy: - If the value is a null JToken - serialize as empty string / JValue of empty string. - If the value is a string JValue - return its value if convert-to-string or "roundtrip" it to get legacy behavior - parse its value and serialize back as JValue. This will result in "123" --> 123 ConvertToString: - Serialize the JToken
If both the above are false, value is returned as is

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.DataRetentionPolicyPersistency
member.summary: Immutable DataRetentionPolicyPersistency to be stored by the engine, but used by the DM, Bridge. The reason that we're modeling it in the engine is just to validate that the json provided is indeed a valid retention policy json.

A policy that states when the data should get removed - the persistency version. In the near future only SoftDeletePeriod and Recoverability will be modified by the user. This class still will keep the full set for persistency and internal commands.

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSet
member.summary: Represents a data set whose tables arrive in a progressive manner, not all at once. This puts the burden on the reader to correctly construct the tables, but makes it possible to start processing partial results immediately.

member.name: E:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSet.Disposing
member.summary: An event that gets raised before the inner stream is disposed.

member.name: E:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSet.Disposed
member.summary: An event that gets raised after the inner stream is disposed.

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetFrame
member.summary:
A "progressive data set" is a data set whose individual data tables are built gradually, frame-by-frame, according to some data source. Some of the frames may even "override" previous frames, and some of them indicate the current state of progression and hold data that does not translate into "useful" payload.
The ProgressiveDataSetFrame is the base class for all types of frames that the progressive data set may have.

member.name: P:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetFrame.FrameType
member.summary: Gets the type of the frame.

member.name: P:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableSchemaFrame.TableId
member.summary: Uniquely identifies the data table in the data set.

member.name: P:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableSchemaFrame.TableKind
member.summary: The data table kind.

member.name: P:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableSchemaFrame.TableName
member.summary: The data table name

member.name: P:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableSchemaFrame.TableSchema
member.summary: The schema of the data table.

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableFragmentFrame
member.summary: Provides the data for a single frame of the data table. The data (one or more records) may be appended to the data table that was already transmitted, or may replace whatever got transmitted completely.

member.name: P:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableFragmentFrame.TableId
member.summary: Uniquely identifies the data table in the data set.

member.name: P:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableFragmentFrame.FieldCount
member.summary: The number of fields (columns) in each record.

member.name: P:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableFragmentFrame.FrameSubType
member.summary: Gets the fragment type, which indicates how this table fragment is related to the ones that preceded it.

member.name: M:Kusto.Data.Results.ProgressiveDataSetDataTableFragmentFrame.GetNextRecord(System.Object[])
member.summary: Get the next record in this data table fragment.
member.param: A non-null array of size FieldCount that is set with the values of each cell in the record on success.
member.returns: TODO:

member.summary: This is a frame, which is the first frame in the protocol (contains protocol metadata - just a version for now)

member.summary: This is a frame, which is the first frame for a new data table in the data set and describes the table and its schema.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Results.FrameType.TableFragment
member.summary: This is a frame, which includes the data table records.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Results.FrameType.TableCompletion
member.summary: This is a frame, which is the last frame of the data table.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Results.FrameType.TableProgress
member.summary: This is a frame, which informs of the progress made so far in a data table.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Results.FrameType.DataTable
member.summary: This is a frame, which represents a (usually) small table which includes the entire table schema and data

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Results.FrameType.DataSetCompletion
member.summary: This is a frame, which is the last frame of the entire data set.

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Results.TableFragmentType
member.summary: Indicates how is this frame related to the previous such frame that preceded it.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Results.TableFragmentType.DataAppend
member.summary: This frame adds additional records on top of the previous records.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Results.TableFragmentType.DataReplace
member.summary: This frame replaces all previous records.

member.name: F:Kusto.Data.Results.TableFragmentType.DataRemove
member.summary: TODO: Ask Amit what that is...

member.summary: Constructor which accepts all fields of the class and the fields of the base classes except for EntityId and EntityKind.
member.param: A code indicating the error.
A short description of the nature of the error.
A more detailed description of the error.
The Kusto service that has returned the error.
The Kusto database indicated by the request as the default database.
The correlation ID provided by the client
The correlation ID used by the service
Gets the failure code associated with the exception. This is a numeric value similar to the HTTP status code), and defaults to 0.
Gets the failure sub-code associated with the exception. This is a string value which elaborates on the failure code, and defaults to "null".
Gets a Boolean indicating whether the exception is permanent and should not be retried. The deault is false.

member.name: T:Kusto.Data.Linq.KustoDataContext
member.summary: Represents the main entry point for the LINQ to Kusto framework.
member.remarks:
The KustoDataContext is the source of all entities mapped over a database connection. Kusto, being a analytics engine (say, unlike SQL Server which is an OLTP database), does not support modifying individual "rows". Therefore, this class is differentiated from DataContext by not providing ways to modify data -- just append and remove data.
Also note that the Kusto data client currently does not implement a connection cache, so it is recommended that applications cache this object themselves instead of creating and recreating it again and again.

member.summary: Constructor.
member.param:
A Kusto connection string builder object that is used to represent the connection to the SQL database. The conversion is done by the "magic" of KustoClientFactory and registered schema handlers. For example, the following connection string should be used for server SERVER.database.windows.net, database DATABASE, with user name USER; how to set the password should be obvious.
sql://SERVER.database.windows.net/DATABASE;User ID=USER;...

member.name: M:Kusto.Cloud.Platform.Http.AadHttpClientAuthenticator.GetUserTokenByPasswordAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
This is the client-side for the [Resource Owner Password Credentials Grant OAuth 2.0](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.3) flow, which is supported by the Azure AD service, but not exposed through ADAL.NET. Unfotunately, ADAL.NET doesn't support any other user-interactive authentication flow in .NET Core (only silent authentication or domain-joined, neither are useful for Linux machines...), so we've elected to implement it ourselves.
A good place for info is: https://github.com/AzureAD/azure-activedirectory-library-for-dotnet/issues/482.
Another option for authentication (which we didn't make) is to do this: https://github.com/Azure-Samples/active-directory-dotnet-deviceprofile
To view the access token or refresh token that the service returns, one can use https://jwt.ms/. See also https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/access-tokens. ///
member.param: The user name to authenticate (UPN). Cannot be null/empty/whitespace.
The password of the user. Cannot be null/empty/whitespace.
The tenant ID (also called authority ID) of the Azure AD tenant. Optional (will be inferred from the domain part of the UPN if provided).
The resource for which access is requested.
The application doing the authentication.
member.returns:
On successful authentication, an access token for the specified user granting access to the specified resource is returned.
On failure, throws an .
